programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: David, Emilia and Dr Graham Hill examine the case of eight-year-old Vishal Mehrotra, whose remains were found in West Sussex seven months after he went missing in London in 1981.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil look back on their best transformations of single-storey living, from an unusual bungalow in Croydon to a dated, 70s-style bungalow in Larne.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole, Simon OBrien and Max McMurdo travel across the UK to find unique items lost in peoples homes to fix up for a profit. This episode features a sidecar.

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: In Romania, Jonas and Ulrike carry on the legacy of their forefathers at a traditional Saxon village. And we catch up with seasoned village saviours Lolly and Sean in France.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A familys renovated French gite springs several leaks. In Spain, back-to-back BandB bookings and a busy bar leave a couple run off their feet. Lesley hopes a coach trip to a tomato throwing festival will prove fruitful for her Spanish tour company.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: The duo return, helping families decide whether to stay put or sell. In Chippenham, Tim craves a fresh start in a new place, but Sonias settled. Will they move on?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Leah Charles-King helps Julie and Leo find the perfect holiday home on the southern Costa Blanca for all three generations of their family to enjoy. With a maximum budget of £120,000, Leah shows them five impressive properties.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Karen and Brian are taking the leap and following their dream of making a permanent move to the Málaga province in southern Spain. Leah Charles-King shows them what their £120k can buy.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Cheltenham, the first to host is 46-year-old Belgian-born hotel consultant Oli Delaunoy. Oli plans to wow his guests with his posh scallop starter and meaty main, but its his loud and vivacious personality hes banking on.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its the second day of the competition in Cheltenham and the turn of glamorous nurse Jan Blomer to host. Jan hopes to impress with her good honest home cooking: chicken with sun dried tomatoes for her main and home-made ice cream for dessert.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Third to host in Cheltenham is super competitive events director and body building fanatic Zak Roby. Zak cooks Thai `Tien of Crab served with fashionable micro herbs and a duo of duck main.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its the fourth day of the competition in Cheltenham and the turn of Aussie admin assistant Kimberley Thomas. She aims for a sophisticated evening, and hopes to impress with her meaty starter of pork belly and apple salad and her pie main course.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its the final day of the competition in Cheltenham, and the turn of stay-at-home dad Paddy Castledine to host. Paddy plans to walk away with the prize by serving a simple menu with quality ingredients.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Shauna and Sam boast a wealth of top-end facilities at a Lancashire glampsite. With hot tubs, cinema screens and pizza ovens all on offer, the BandBers really do feel like they have fallen down some sort of luxurious, facility-laden rabbit hole.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Abi and daughter Maddys Victorian cottage in Surrey isnt working for them. Will Phils fabulous houses win them over, or could Kirsties amazing renovation clinch it?

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Does food keep you warm? Which foods cause the most flatulence? Plus: the miraculous healing powers of crab shells. And Matt investigates fish preservation.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its Pastry Week... lets hope for no soggy bottoms! Savoury plaits are on the menu, but who will have the judges tongue-tied? And whose gala pie will be their final goodbye?

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: The celeb Goggleboxers watching some television include Miquita and Andi Oliver, Rylan Clark, Chris Packham, Shaun Ryder and Bez, Annie Mac, Stephen Mangan, Gyles Brandreth, and Lulu.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britains sharpest armchair critics share more of their sharp, insightful, passionate and sometimes emotional critiques of the weeks biggest and best shows on television.

programme.title: Hunted
programme.desc: Fourteen civilians become fugitives, attempting a daring escape from Stansted Airport to win a share of £100,000. They must evade Chief Ray Howard and his crack team of hunters for 21 days.

programme.title: Hunted
programme.desc: With one fugitive already cleared from the board, the hunters are hungry for more. Could the loved-up couple in the hot tub be their next capture, or will sibling rivalry be another fugitives undoing?

programme.title: Social Media Monsters
programme.desc: Stories of serious crimes linked to social media. When businesswoman Justine Wright lets an employee go, it sparks a decade-long stalking campaign against Justine and others.

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: After a car mounts the pavement, pedestrians with serious injuries are brought into AandE. Jodies cut her leg on glass on a night out. And is 61-year-old Crispin having a stroke?

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: David, Emilia and Dr Graham Hill examine the case of eight-year-old Vishal Mehrotra, whose remains were found in West Sussex seven months after he went missing in London in 1981.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Ania Magliano asks a stranger about their marital status, Phil Ellis strips to his base layer and Reece Shearsmith destroys a valuable ornament. Throughout it all, Greg Davies expertly maintains order with his usual stern authority.

programme.title: Cruise TV with LoveitBookit
programme.desc: A definitive one-stop shop for all things cruise, bringing you the hottest destinations and the latest deals to ensure that your next cruise ship holiday is your greatest one yet.

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc: The Beast from the East descends, covering parts of the UK in a blanket of snow and ice and bringing some of the countrys busiest roads to a standstill. Phones are ringing off the hook at as scores of drivers are left stranded on Britains roads.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: An insight into this rarely seen world of high stakes, colourful characters and extreme conditions.

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc: A 44-tonne gravel lorry careers off the A697, plunging down an embankment, and Gary must pick up the pieces. In Croydon, Stu has a complex recovery: a bin lorry is stuck in deep mud.

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Even though its only just after 10am, a woman is suspected of drink-driving and traffic cop Matt Copestake is called to investigate. Traffic cop Andy Swift is on the trail of a driver who has allegedly failed to stop after a collision.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dog handler Steve rides to the aid of the armed response team after reports of a man drawing a gun on a pizza delivery driver, Charley and Wayne takeaway a drink driver at the drive thru, and Warren begins the foot pursuit to end all foot pursuits.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Interceptor Mick leads a team raiding two flats whose occupants are suspected of producing and selling spice. Duncan is involved in a high-speed pursuit, which ends with tracker dog Tia on the escaping offenders trail.

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: A gunman is obsessed with tracking down and killing the man who stole his tramp wife. However, a gun duel reveals the truth.

programme.title: Entertainment News On 5
programme.desc: A daily round-up of showbiz news and gossip from around the world, focusing on celebrities, movies, music and entertainment.

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: A gunman is obsessed with tracking down and killing the man who stole his tramp wife. However, a gun duel reveals the truth.

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc: A 26-tonne tanker gets stuck in a waterlogged verge on the busy A5, fully loaded and leaning to one side. Plus, moving an ageing double decker bus thats been immobile for eight years.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A runaway driver flees an accident in a decommissioned ambulance, then crashes through a level crossing and ditches his ride on a live railway line. While a chopper tracks the suspect, cops frantically battle to close the railway line.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A reckless driver gives Sergeant Steve the slip in bad weather but whatever their wiles on the ground, the sly suspect cannot escape the eye in the sky. Ben has a run-in with an argumentative drink driver who fails three breath tests.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A white van man makes a break for it after ploughing into a parked car, a suspect is not keen on wearing a set of cuffs, and the driver of a stolen car is brought to a halt thanks to some railings.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: As the end of the season nears, Mark Kohaykewych makes a deal with rivals Darrell Ward and Lisa Kelly to join forces for a four-truck convoy; Alex Debogorski must complete one of the longest trails; Art Burkes truck gives out on the ice.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The truckers in the historic four-truck convoy, face fire and a thin crossing; after Art Burkes engine dies, he must travel back to Winnipeg with Alex Debogorski over a trail that destroys his truck.

programme.title: Worlds Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: ...Caught on Camera. British travellers flee a raging wildfire on the Greek island of Rhodes. A hailstorm disrupts an outdoor concert in Colorado, giving guests an unexpected show. (S6 Ep7)

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Matty sends the team to Ghana to recover a hard drive from an e-waste landfill that is run by a powerful and violent man, leading them to speculate about what could be on the device.

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis reveals how CCTV and technological advances are helping to catch criminals. Packed with shocking footage recorded on closed-circuit TV and featuring a wide range of criminal activity.

programme.desc: In Bradford theres a high-octane chase through a housing estate, a cocky petrol thief tries every trick in the book to wriggle free and Yorkshires back roads have their peace disturbed by two cars carrying gun-toting drug dealers.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The interceptors chase down two separate runaways using wildly different tactics. Plus, dog handler Duncan assists armed response officers in Leeds city centre following reports of a man with a pistol.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Kev and Spenner are in pursuit of a driver who is so drunk that he cant even keep his car on the road and the chase ends with shocking results. Elsewhere, dog handler Tony comes across an unusual sight - a naked man stranded at the side of the road.

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A gang of burglars break into a house and swipe the keys to luxury cars, before fleeing in three stolen vehicles.

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britains Speeders
programme.desc: With three million dashcams now in vehicles, a look at some of Britains worst driving offenders.

programme.title: Frontline Police 24/7
programme.desc: Using footage from bodycams, force helicopters and CCTV, getting a unique first-hand and adrenaline-fuelled perspective of the dangers police officers face around the world.

programme.title: Police Code Zero: Officer Under Attack
programme.desc: Officers are under attack when a gang attempts to ram into a police car. Elsewhere, a man gets too close and tries to grab an officers crotch.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: An Irish military intelligence officer claims to know the whereabouts of a lethal bomb maker whom Mac has been hunting for years.

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The dog unit embark on a desperate manhunt amid fears that a weapon-wielding brawler is roaming the streets of Lincoln. Craggy closes in on a shop thief with a suspicious bag full of surprises.

programme.title: Shoplifters: At War With The Law
programme.desc: In Newton Abbot, a pensioner was shopping when a woman reached into her bag and stole an envelope of money. In Coventry, Mal spots a suspected drug user who already has a lifetime ban. In London, a suspicious duo enters a major department store.

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: After being stabbed, Bree is struggling to breathe through a punctured lung, while Jo and other hospital staff work to keep her calm.

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Brees strong, and pulls through her medical relapse, apologetic to Levi whos mildly entertained by the fact shes saying sorry.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: New Year brings in some patients hoping to make fresh starts. Dr Ramshaw has some encouraging words for Nicola who is trying to lose weight, Dr Cordell asks a patient to be open about his drinking habits, and Ali worries about giving up smoking.

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: Junior doctor Jake Mullen oversees the treatment of 17-year-old Dan, whos been rushed in by ambulance. Elsewhere, Dr Humphreys first patient is 56-year-old John, who dislocated his shoulder at work.

programme.title: Ambulance: Code Red
programme.desc: Paramedics race to High Wycombe where a handyman has fallen 18ft from a ladder, risking catastrophic internal injuries. Elsewhere, 53-year-old Paula has had a suspected stroke.

programme.title: 999 Critical Condition
programme.desc: A man is rushed in with some of the worst facial injuries the team have ever seen, a woman is badly injured in a road accident, and a patient arrives after a serious fall in a care home.

programme.title: Skin AandE
programme.desc: Dr Emma meets a man with a strange looking lump on his arm. Theres an odd ear lump for Dr Magnus, exploding head cysts for Dr Adil and a large leg lump on a dance teacher for Dr Dev.

programme.title: Prison Brides
programme.desc: Lithuanian bride, Gabriella, faces criticism from her sister regarding her fiance, Jamals second-degree murder charges.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Doctors treat a bus driver with foot pain, while Dr Prestwick helps a girl with epilepsy whos at risk of seizures when ill. Another patient experiences hallucinations from Parkinsons.

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: Sister Jane clocks in for her 12-hour shift at Barnsley Hospital. An ambulance is en route with a patient in a critical condition. Another patient is blue-lighted in. Nurse Johnny administers pain relief as Nurse Tony prepares Jessicas cast.

programme.desc: Feumaidh Boban cluasag ùr a lorg s tha min dòchas gum faigh e tè fhreagarrach, oir chan eil coltas g eil tè seach tè buileach ceart! Boban needs a new pillow that is suitable, but not one appears to be quite right.

programme.title: An Teaghlach Rìoghail an Ath-dhoras
programme.desc: Tha Molaidh na boil nuair a tha i fhèin is Stella a dol a-mach air Oidhche Shamhna. Tha Stella a dèanamh a-mach gu bheil i ro shean air a shon - ach an dùil a bheil sin fìor? Molaidh is really excited when herself and Stella are going to go out trick or treating. Stella makes out she is too old for Halloween - but is this really true?

programme.title: An Teaghlach Rìoghail an Ath-dhoras

programme.title: An Doimhne

programme.title: Gàrraidhean Mòra na h-Alba

programme.title: Henry VIII: Patron or Plunderer?
programme.desc: In the 1530s, King Henry VIII was at a crossroads. In his desperation for a new wife and an heir, he had broken with Rome, divorced Katherine of Aragon and married Anne Boleyn. Isolated and vulnerable, he needed a powerful new image as head of church and state. Jonathan Foyle looks for clues in the kings art to glimpse what was going on inside Henrys head as he faced his darkest days.

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: Three, two, one, lift off! This edition launches into the extraordinary - and extraterrestrial - world of astronaut training, discovering what it truly takes to become a European Space Agency (ESA) astronaut. As Europe looks to play a more prominent role in space exploration, we shine a spotlight on the candidates who are pushing boundaries and preparing to represent Great Britain and Northern Ireland amongst the stars.

programme.title: The Great Philosophers

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: Martha Nussbaum presents a programme about Aristotle, Platos star pupil and tutor to the young Alexander the Great. His philosophy dominated western thought for many hundreds of years and is still studied at every university.

programme.desc: Join Gethin Jones, Helen Skelton, Michelle Ackerley and the team for conversation, advice and tips to make your day that little bit easier.

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Police appeal for information about allegations of past sexual abuse at a school. And the extraordinary story of the gang who stole a gold toilet from Blenheim Palace.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin is in Warwickshire to see a property above a former brewery with a quirky layout and a holey roof. Dion heads to Staffordshire to visit a three-bed mid-terrace with a huge back garden boasting elevated views over Stoke-on-Trent. And we return to Nottinghamshire to find out how the story ends for a couple who bought a former farm building at auction and planned to turn it into their forever home.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Take a seat as Natasha learns about a pioneering furniture designer. The teams arent lounging about, however, as they hunt for bargains with Kate Bliss and Danny Sebastian in Ardingly.

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: Former police officer Ahron is tracking a stolen MG following a spate of car thefts in Leeds. He finds an illegal chop shop - but has the MG already been broken up for parts?

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: The intrepid Lost and Found team take on a desperate search to find two beloved rings. A local crafter is challenged to transform abandoned scrap, giving it a new lease of life. After a valuable chance find during one of their underwater searches, social media detective Mui tries to track down the owner.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Emotions are running high during a house hunt in Herefordshire, where Sonali Shah is helping a couple to make a fresh start in the countryside after a life-changing event.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Confronted with a contraption that has clearly seen better days, a daunted Dominic Chinea is taking on the barns first assignment. All the way from Scotland, brothers Lewis and Ross have wheeled in their familys mobile ice cream trailer. Keen to share the inside scoop on the family business, they reveal that theyve been serving up gelato in St Andrews, Fife since 1908 when their great-great-grandfather came over from Italy and started selling the yummy stuff from a shop in the centre of town.

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz, packed with strategy, high stakes and surprises, where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret stash of cash - anything between zero and a whopping £4,000.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Trevor Nelson for the brainy quiz where the contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of.

programme.title: Why...?

programme.title: Crimewatch Live

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A large home in Barry in south Wales, a terrace in Nuneaton in Warwickshire and a quirky one-bedroom flat in a Victorian former schoolhouse on the Isle of Wight are sold at auction. Martin, Martel and Jacqui meet the new owners and hear their plans for their investment projects.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross travels to Shrewsbury in Shropshire, where Tim Weeks and Ben Cooper provide expert help as the red and blue teams compete to see who can make the most profit at auction. Charlie goes round the fair quizzing members of the public on a rather unusual antique he has brought along.

programme.desc: The latest national and international news, followed by weather.

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: Tracker Neil hunts down a stolen Toyota Hilux hidden on a remote industrial estate. But before he can seize it, hes confronted by a man claiming he bought it at an auction.

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: The scuba team dive to their greatest depth yet to search on behalf of heartbroken newlyweds. Crafter Lucy takes on a shattered teapot fished out of the water and attempts to make something truly special out of it. And social media detective Mui tries to get a phone full of memories back to its rightful owner.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson explores one of the UKs most beautiful locations today as he sets about finding the ideal Wye Valley property for his house hunters. Having put their Portugal home on the market, theyve recently been touring the UK in their beloved camper van named Dave and are itching to settle down somewhere with more space inside and out!

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team rescue a jacket worn by a beloved search dog involved in the Lockerbie disaster, as well as tackle a pair of rugby boots that helped England win the Womens World Cup.

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz, packed with strategy, high stakes and surprises, where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret stash of cash - anything between zero and a whopping £4,000.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Trevor Nelson for the brainy quiz where the contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of.

programme.title: Stacey and Joe
programme.sub-title: Theres Life in the Old Dog Still
programme.desc: Stacey heads to stunning Lake Como as shes all set to launch a new product as part of her beauty brand... but this time shes also the model! Its not all plain sailing as she takes to the lake to get her vogue on. But, more importantly, will she bump into local resident George Clooney? Meanwhile, Joe is left holding the fort back at Pickle Cottage. In Staceys absence, Joe finds himself juggling kids, a long list of chores and all the animal care, so hes invited his family over to help out.

Having put their Portugal home on the market, theyve recently been touring the UK in their beloved camper van named Dave and are itching to settle down somewhere with more space inside and out!

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team rescue a jacket worn by a beloved search dog involved in the Lockerbie disaster, as well as tackle a pair of rugby boots that helped England win the Womens World Cup.

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz, packed with strategy, high stakes and surprises, where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret stash of cash - anything between zero and a whopping £4,000.

programme.title: Pointless

Its not all plain sailing as she takes to the lake to get her vogue on. But, more importantly, will she bump into local resident George Clooney? Meanwhile, Joe is left holding the fort back at Pickle Cottage. programme.title: Martin Compstons Scottish Fling

programme.title: The Mart
programme.desc: A Shetland farmer is relying on Finley to get the cash he needs to feed his flock over the winter. A crisis occurs in the kitchen minutes before lunch, and auctioneer Charlie sells all the worldly goods of two farming brothers retiring after fifty years.

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotlands Lochs
programme.desc: This Grand Tour starts at Loch Glashan above Loch Fyne, where Paul travels back in time to learn how to paddle a coracle. At Old Castle Lachlan, he dabbles in Victorian virtual reality, courtesy of George Washington Wilson and his stereoscopic camera. At the open-air museum of Auchindrain, Paul follows Queen Victoria on the trail of poverty tourism, before having fun with the tale of MacPhunn - a man who cheated the noose.

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Rob Rinder and Monica Galetti work at high altitude, 3000 metres above sea-level at a hidden gem of a hotel with Buddhist connections in the remote kingdom of Bhutan.

programme.title: River City
programme.desc: Desperate to get out of her baby shower, Ambers actions backfire spectacularly. Meanwhile, a guilt-ridden Gillian struggles to cope after Jonathons death, and Kelly-Marie grows increasingly frustrated as Chris attempts to win her back.

programme.title: Dinosaur
programme.desc: Nina was happy in her world, until her sisters news threatens to change everything.

programme.title: Scotcast
programme.desc: Conversation about Scotlands biggest news stories, hosted by Martin Geissler.

programme.title: The Trials That Shocked Scotland
programme.desc: In 2004, Luke Mitchell stood trial for the murder of his teenage girlfriend Jodi Jones, who was killed the previous year in Dalkeith, Midlothian. Her death sent shockwaves throughout the community and across Scotland. Four years later, the trial began of the man accused of murdering Shamsuddin Mahmood, 14 years after his death. British Army soldier Michael Ross was accused of shooting and killing the Bangladeshi national. It was the first murder on the island in a quarter of a century.

programme.title: Scotland from the Sky
programme.desc: Presenter James Crawford takes to the air to discover how the wild landscapes of Scotland influence sporting lives. He travels to the volcanic landmark Ailsa Craig, on the trail of the best curling stones in the world and follows their journey from quarry to Olympic ice. In the Outer Hebrides he tracks down a golf course, designed by the founding father of course design that was almost lost to history, buried in the wild landscape of South Uist.

programme.title: Murder Trial
programme.desc: A look into the heart of the long-awaited murder trial of one of Scotlands most notorious unsolved mysteries - the sudden, unexpected disappearance of Renee MacRae and her three-year-old son, Andrew.

programme.title: Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: The Disappearance of Renee and Andrew MacRae
programme.desc: The trial continues, with developments centring around the testimony of the victims best friend. There is compelling testimony suggesting MacDowell attempted to create a fake alibi, and a final witness is called as the Crowns case nears conclusion.

programme.desc: Conversation about Scotlands biggest news stories, hosted by Martin Geissler.

programme.title: David Wilsons Crime Files
programme.desc: David Wilson investigates how faith can be exploited by scammers and fraudsters to target vulnerable people who are looking for answers to lifes big questions. He looks back to the story of Helen Duncan, a self-styled psychic medium.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Mankinds most ingenious inventors are given the `Horrible Histories treatment, as we take in everything from the invention of the wheel to the crisp. Featuring the Gutenberg press, the man who invented both the dictionary and manned flight. Also the Greeks and the Chinese battle as to which of them are historys best inventors.

programme.title: The Catch-Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news.

programme.sub-title: UEFA European Qualifiers, Group J: Wales v Belgium
programme.desc: Catrin Heledd presents live coverage of Waless crucial World Cup qualifier against Belgium from the Cardiff City Stadium. programme.desc: Documentary on sextortion.

programme.title: Stranded On Honeymoon Island: Australia
programme.desc: With less than a week to go, the couples are contemplating their relationships on the outside, where the distractions of everyday life will all come back into play.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.desc: Professor Phillip Goodman devotes his life to exposing phony psychics and fraudulent supernatural shenanigans. His scepticism is soon put to the test when he receives news of three chilling and inexplicable cases: disturbing visions in an abandoned asylum, a car accident deep in the woods, and the spirit of an unborn child. Even scarier, each of the macabre stories seems to have a sinister connection to the professors own life.

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: River Hunters sees Rick and river-searching expert Beau searching the unexplored rivers and waterways of Britain, unearthing treasures from the past which reveal how our various ancestors used to live.

programme.title: Dickinsons Real Deal
programme.desc: Today Coalville in Leicestershire plays host to David Dickinson and his team, where Alison Chapman has her work cut out with a seller whos brought in a Clarice Cliff jam pot, Tony Geering tries his best to buy a set of lead toy soldiers and one seller drives a hard bargain for his cavalry sword.

programme.title: Junk and Disorderly
programme.desc: Henry Cole, Allen Millyard and Guy Willison are back searching Britains sheds and auction houses for hidden gems - this time they revamp their stall after picking up a vanload of trinkets from their favourite dealer Matt. With hopes high after two tough weekends, they set their sights on a big sale at a mega jumble held by Sammy Miller.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: In New Orleans, Ton and Allen visit a tough local auction and win a Mardi Gras unit with a confetti blaster and a modern calliope.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: The guys buy a legendary golf and instantly fall for it. At first everything seems to be fine with the car, but the truth is revealed when they remove the trim strips around the wheel well.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les discovers Seths masterplan for a new business structure at the Gold family pawn shop, leading to a huge stand-off between father and son.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions are at an all-time high in the store, as Seth and Les jockey for power. As the chaos begins to affect business, Ashley stages an intervention.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: All eyes are on Seth as he tries to prove hes worthy of the keys to the kingdom, but as business heats up, can he stay calm under the mounting pressure?

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: Some scientists theorize that mass extinctions happened on Earth 65 million years ago due to powerful megastorms known as hypercanes, reaching 20 miles into the stratosphere.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: After a decade of searching, Rick, Marty, and the team return to Oak Island and immediately uncover evidence of a tunnel in the Money Pit; the Fellowship gets a clear look at an underground structure, getting them closer to solving the mystery.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Ricks in the big apple to see if he can compute a deal on a rare piece of tech; a seller flies into the shop with a special edition Stan Lee Funko Pop figure.

programme.title: Junk and Disorderly: Henrys Wreck-Trospective
programme.desc: Motoring maverick Henry Cole goes through over a decades worth of footage, featuring oily chaos, revisiting the best barn finds, examining the worst breakdowns and biggest rebuilds.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: The classic Fiat 500 is too expensive, so the team decide to look for a Fiat 126. Will and Gus hunt for neglected cars that they can fix and flip for a profit, but any losses will come out of their own pockets.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.sub-title: Ancient Aliens On Location: Incredible Structures
programme.desc: Ancient Aliens has travelled to many mysterious sites that seem to defy explanation. Now, Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a look back at some of the most incredible structures weve visited all over the world.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.sub-title: Ancient Aliens On Location: Extraordinary Encounters
programme.desc: Ancient Aliens has followed investigators across the globe as theyve gone directly to the sites where unexplained incidents have been reported. Now, Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a look back at the most extraordinary encounters.

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: Humanitys rapid technological advances have transformed the way humans live. Could extraterrestrials been involved and aided these scientific innovations?

programme.title: Junk and Disorderly: Henrys Wreck-Trospective
programme.desc: Motoring maverick Henry Cole goes through over a decades worth of footage, featuring oily chaos, revisiting the best barn finds, examining the worst breakdowns and biggest rebuilds.

programme.title: Dickinsons Real Deal
programme.desc: Today Ilford plays host to David Dickinson and his team, where Michael Hogben cant believe his luck when a pair of Doulton figurines arrive at his table, Henry Nicholls tries his best to buy a Breitling watch and seller Mary drives a hard bargain for her collection of silver gilt coins.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: When Rick and Marty finally get underground in the Garden Shaft for the first time this year, they may be foiled by an ancient booby trap.

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: One of the holiest and most powerful relics from the Bible has been missing for over 2,000 years. While some believe the Ark of the Covenant was destroyed, many people think its still out there. Could new clues finally tell us what happened?

programme.title: Greatest Prison Escapes With Billy Hayes
programme.desc: A female con artist manipulates another woman into breaking their significant others out of a Correctional Facility with a hijacked helicopter.

programme.title: Weird Britain
programme.desc: Andy visits Worcestershire to honour his childhood rock hero, explores a gender-biased cave, and unravels the mystery of "Who Put Bella in the Wych Elm?" He later meets a treasure hunter and enjoys May Day Morris dancing.

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: UFO researchers believe NASA is hiding the truth about alien life. Could the deathbed confessions of famous scientists reveal a history of otherworldly contact?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Throughout the ancient world, tales were told of fire-breathing dragons. Though fearsome, they were often worshipped as the bringers of great knowledge and credited as the founders of civilisation.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Today, more people than ever before believe that Unidentified Flying Objects are of alien origin. But if extraterrestrials have come to Earth from lightyears away, could they be capable of bending both time and space?

programme.desc: Ross agonises over whether he should stay with Julie or date Rachel. The gang encourage him to compare the two, so he starts with a list of Rachels negative qualities. Unfortunately, Rachel sees the list.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The boys are back in Alaska (although Discovery dropped the states mention in the title after the first season) hoping to strike it rich mining for gold. Their first effort was anything but rich and glorious, however, as the crew led by Todd Hoffman and his father, Jack, sunk $250,000 into their dream and came away with just $20,000 worth of gold. The dismal summer was filled with injuries, malfunctioning equipment and constant fighting among the greenhorn miners, yet their serious case of gold fever trumps any talk of giving up and leads to a new operating plan in order to salvage their dream. The series also keeps tabs on the efforts of teenager Parker Schnabel and old-timer Dakota Fred to hit the mother lode at separate sites.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay returns to restaurants he tried to help in the past, such as Downcity in Providence, RI, Classic American in West Babylon, NY, and Davide in Boston to check on their progress.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon is in Atlanta, Georgia, to visit Michons, a family-run smokehouse restaurant with a future thats about to go up in smoke because of mismanagement and lazy cooking. Michons owner, Al Wilson, had always hoped that one day he would pass his beloved restaurant over to his daughter, Natalie. But when he suffered a collapsed lung, the handover came about much earlier than expected.

programme.title: Below Deck Mediterranean
programme.sub-title: Caught Between a Dock and a Heart Place
programme.desc: Tensions flare when two stews pursue the same deckhand; with a charter on the horizon, Aesha is rushed to the hospital, leaving her interior team in disarray; the deck team is still recovering from a difficult charter and struggles to maintain order.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Raj is asked to create a message in case a NASA mission discovers alien life, the guys fight over what he should do. Meanwhile, Penny is torn between auditioning for a movie or keeping her successful pharmaceutical sales job.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Two physicists learn how little they know about life when a beautiful woman comes into their lives.

programme.title: Taskmaster Bleeped
programme.desc: Greg Davies personal valet Alex Horne diligently notes the facts and figures as Ardal OHanlon makes some sheep, Chris Ramsey gets younger, Judi Love becomes a queen, Sophie Duker wets some teabags and Bridget Christie gets lost in a small field.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Sean Lock and Joe Wilkinson take on Jon Richardson and Sara Pascoe. Sam Simmons is in Dictionary Corner, while maths whizz Rachel Riley looks after the letters and numbers.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay returns to restaurants he tried to help in the past, such as Downcity in Providence, RI, Classic American in West Babylon, NY, and Davide in Boston to check on their progress.

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: The priests take themselves off to their annual holiday in the Kilkelly Caravan Park. Unfortunately, the places attractions, The Magic Road and St Kevins Stump, are marred by a suspicious couple living nearby, an over-excitable youth group and more rain than the average monsoon.

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: In order to fix their leaky roof, Father Ted gets a car to raffle, but then theres a bit of a problem with the bodywork and he, Dougal and Jack borrow another one from the Dancing Priest. How are they going to get it back after its been won?

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: With guests Gok Wan, Sarah Millican, Seann Walsh and Amy Childs.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Sean Lock and Joe Wilkinson take on Jon Richardson and Sara Pascoe. Sam Simmons is in Dictionary Corner, while maths whizz Rachel Riley looks after the letters and numbers.

programme.title: Taskmaster Bleeped
programme.desc: Greg Davies personal valet Alex Horne diligently notes the facts and figures as Ardal OHanlon makes some sheep, Chris Ramsey gets younger, Judi Love becomes a queen, Sophie Duker wets some teabags and Bridget Christie gets lost in a small field.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Gloria, Claire, Haley, Alex, Lily, Luke and Manny show support for gender equality and the womens movement in their own ways; Jay and Phil butt heads over their parking attendant; Cam feels jealous when Pam prefers Mitchells help with the baby.

programme.title: Hollyoaks: Omnibus
programme.desc: Tensions rise in Graces family, and a row erupts between sisters. Tom and Peri rekindle their teenage romance and a resident plots revenge. The village holds a vigil for the serial killers victims, and Cleo visits Joel in prison.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Clare sets out for revenge, while the walls close in on Jez. And a resident is determined to end their familys reign of destruction.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A proposal is interrupted by a shock announcement, and Lucas and Dillon are at loggerheads. Meanwhile, a resident receives an ultimatum.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The opening episode of a new series sees Gordon in Plainfield, New Jersey, trying to save a floundering soul food restaurant called Blackberrys. He comes up against the indomitable Shelley, an owner who runs her establishment with an iron fist, and doesnt want to hear what Gordon has to say. Gordon must find a way to convince her to change her ways if the restaurant is going to stand a chance.

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: The final newly-weds embark on their honeymoons, but will physical intimacy lead to a deeper connection? And a badly behaved husband receives a word of warning.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Guess Whos Coming to Criticize Dinner
programme.desc: Homer affects the way trendy people eat when he becomes a local food critic, until he starts giving restaurants bad reviews.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer causes an incident at the nuclear power plant, radiation from X-rays gives Bart and Lisa superpowers, and Flanders is killed.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Proton Displacement When Professor Proton contacts Leonard instead of Sheldon for help, Sheldon turns to another TV scientist, Bill Nye. Also, Raj gets jealous when Howard crashes a girls night.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard attempts to try and keep Sheldon from overreacting to a mistake, forcing Sheldon to make Leonard experience first hand what its like to be him. Elsewhere, Penny runs into Rajs ex-girlfriend Lucy.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam embarks on a juice fast and Mitch is helpless as he watches him go through the different stages of dieting. Plus, Phil decides to take up the tightrope.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay is determined to help Manny sell wrapping paper for a school fundraiser, and Claire petitions the city for a stop sign to be installed at a high-traffic intersection.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon struggles to keep his emotions in check when he is interviewed for a documentary about Spock. Penny and Leonard make a surprising discovery, while Wolowitz and Bernadette get into a disagreement about remodelling his childhood home.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon, Wolowitz and Koothrappali post an ad online to find a new girlfriend for Sheldon. Meanwhile, Penny and Bernadette decide to spy when Amy is secretive about who she is dating.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy and Sheldon spend Thanksgiving at the aquarium -- as friends. Wolowitz volunteers at the soup kitchen with Raj, Emily and Bernadette. Penny realizes that Leonard knows her better than she thought.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is driven to distraction when he cant get a familiar tune out of his head or recall the name of the song. Amy and Dave arrange another date, but Bernadette is unsure about whether Amy should invite Dave over to her apartment.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Diaz and Santiago team up to take down a ruthless killer who has managed to elude them for seven years. Jeffords helps Peralta with wedding duties. Captain Holt and his rival Olivia Crawford try to convince each other to step down from the campaign.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The precinct squad rush to save Peralta and Santiagos wedding day from a major threat, and Captain Holt receives an email revealing whether or not he has succeeded in his bid to become Police Commissioner.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Simpsons console a grieving friend when he loses a loved one to an untimely death.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is forced to join the Peace Corps after he reneges on an anonymous $10,000 pledge to PBS.

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: The final newly-weds embark on their honeymoons, but will physical intimacy lead to a deeper connection? And a badly behaved husband receives a word of warning.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Tensions rise when the guys struggle to complete their Air Force project on time and are forced to work around the clock, leaving Sheldon fighting to stay awake. Penny and Amy attend a university gathering at the home of Bert the geologist.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Amys apartment is flooded, she has to vacate it for five weeks while repairs are carried out and proposes a `cohabitation experiment with Sheldon. Howard and Bernadette have decided they dont want to know the gender of their unborn child.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Never one to miss the opportunity to make a quick buck, Homer cashes in on Maggies bout of chicken pox. He decides to host a Pox Party and charges parents to infect their children.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart ends up in a coma after attempting to jump from the roof to the swimming pool at Spinster Arms Apartments, while attending a hunting party at Burns Manor, Homer panics and believes the prey is the hunting party, and after losing a Halloween costume contest to Dr Hibbert as Dracula, a real witch puts a spell on the people of Springfield.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Tony and Diane are consumed by wedding planning, but Tony is distracted by having to pacify a demanding Marie. And could anything be more awkward than a lunch with Darren and Nancy?

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: With her crimes exposed, the hunt is on for Nico; will jailbird Sienna help catch her deadly daughter? Joe has a surprise in store for Mercedes, but will it all go to plan?

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: An English teacher with 25 facial piercings meets a bibliophile whos never had a boyfriend. And a 70-year-old joker has a date with a dance-loving 69-year-old whos into grinding.

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: At the third dinner party, confessions are served with a side dish of jealousy, as one bride comes clean and a new brides arrival and antics stir the group.

programme.desc: Favourite foods from Oklahoma; saucy chili cheese tots, an onion burger and crispy fried okrah; an over the top boozy blended root beer float.

programme.title: Jamies Easy Meals for Every Day
programme.desc: Jamie takes mushrooms to a whole new level with his cheesy baked mushroom soup, and gives a classic salad a tasty twist with a cauliflower remoulade.

programme.title: Jamies Easy Meals for Every Day
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver cooks his incredible avocado pastry quiche and shows inventive ways to cook his barbecue favourites, taking a classic steak to the next level.

programme.desc: James Martin enters the `City of Dreams in style while driving a vintage Porsche on his way to some of the standout food highlights of the series. After a visit to an incredible food market in Santa Monica, James heads to the beach to cook up a storm.

programme.desc: It is a chocoholics dream with chocolate cake, brownies and a chocolate box with truffles.

programme.title: James Martin: Sweet

programme.desc: Paul meets up with his friend, Omar Allibhoy, a native Madrileño who knows all the best places to eat in Madrid. At a bakery set up to supply the Spanish royal family, Paul finds traditional choux pastry treats filled with a sweet cream.

programme.title: Paul Hollywood City Bakes
programme.desc: Paul is in Warsaw, discovering a cafe scene at Odette that would out-do even the best Paris can offer. With head chef Jarek Nowakowski, Paul creates a new take on the Polish babka, a sponge flavoured with citrus, honey and coconut.

programme.title: Ravneet Gills Chop House
programme.desc: Ravneet and Mattie gear up to open their unique take on a traditional chop house. They test a pork and mash recipe and a unique Black Forest gateau.

programme.title: Ravneet Gills Chop House
programme.desc: With two months to launch, Ravneet and Mattie are £70k over budget! They test fish and chips with salad, and Ravneet makes her mums chicken pulao.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits Americas most interesting and unique restaurants.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: In Virginia Beach, a real deal barbeque joint serves up burnt ends on a bun with homemade rub and smokey sauce. In San Antonio, Texas, a Greek owner hand rolls tortillas for Mexican favourites.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Mofongo, homemade focaccia and stuffed meatballs.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, Guys tasting his way through the day. In Tampa Bay, Florida, authentic Mexican street food for the lunch crowd is served out of bus, crankin out favourites like butternut squash tostadas. In Virginia Beach, Virginia, dinner at this popular seafood joint includes totally fresh oysters Rockefeller. And in San Antonio, Texas, a breakfast joint servin up waffles filled with bacon.

programme.desc: Paul is in Munich, where he learns the secret of its famous pretzels, tries baumkuchen, and makes a delicious beer hall favourite, a dampfnudel dessert, traditionally served hot with black cherries and custard.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond has a care package for her youngest college kid, Todd. Shes sending him Mini Strawberry Tarts and Chocolate Hazelnut Oatmeal Bars to share with his roommates, cheesy Chipotle Cheddar Snack Mix and Spirit Pretzels in his team colours.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins take the eight passionate home bakers who made it through the first round to Scone Palace near Perth to make biscuits and teatime treats.

programme.title: Jamies Great Britain
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver travels Britain to find out what makes our food great. Hes searching for new ideas and inspiration to create his own versions of British classics. He kicks off his road-trip close to home in the East End, uncovering his familys roots in the area and tasting classic pie and mash and modern Vietnamese street food, as well as meeting a chef turning humble burgers into gourmet cuisine.

programme.desc: Jamie shows how juicy steak and crispy fries are effortlessly achieved. He grills a wonderful piece of meat and serves it with twice-baked garlic sage potatoes. Also included are sweet and sour onions in thyme, caramelised pineapple tart, and more.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, in Detroit, Michigan, a pizza joint makes pizza pies with homemade toppings, and a unique crepe-filled lasagna. And in Chicago, Illinois, the tiny dive servin up flavour in massive proportions, like the melt-in-your-mouth pork belly sandwich.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, Guys in for some old school favourite and new school stunners. In Detroit, Michigan, a Polish joint thats been around for decades, servin up old standards like Hungarian pancakes with goulash.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from the London and South East region. The two remaining chefs cook their entire menus for judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges arent easily pleased and only world class cooking will do. The chefs task is to create a menu which captures the Olympic spirit.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the battle of the Wales chefs: returning contenders Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry. All are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. Stephen Terry cooks `The Opening Ceremony, Richard Davies makes ravioli of quail, parfait of foie gras, roasted salsify and Madeira jelly, and James Sommerin cooks sage cream, onion, chicken and Welsh `Brie truffle toast.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry are all determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. They cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Will it be Stephen Terry with `The Fish and Shellfish Medley, Richard Davies with compression of vine tomato, poached lobster and hand dived scallop, or James Sommerin with lobster and Iberico ham, spiced butter and broccoli?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry cook their main course, but only one chef will take gold. Will it be Stephen Terry with `The Bunny Pentathlon, Richard Davies with slow cooked rib of beef, beetroot ketchup, bone marrow and braised shallot, or James Sommerin with mangalitsa pork, carrot, liquorice and leek?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry cook their dessert, but who will impress? Stephen Terry with `Bronze, Silver or Gold?, Richard Davies with passion fruit cream and gel with bitter chocolate sorbet or James Sommerin with raspberry and lemon cheesecake? `Great British Menu veteran Angela Hartnett decides who goes through to the judges on Friday and who is going home.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from Wales. The two remaining chefs cook their entire menus for judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges arent easily pleased and only world class cooking will do.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: South West contenders Paul Ainsworth and Nathan Outlaw, plus newcomer Simon Hulstone, kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be Paul with his `Breakfast of Champions; Nathan with hogs pudding with seaweed, potato terrine and mushroom ketchup; or Simon Hulstone with track and field - beetroot and goats cheese?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their fish course, but which one but which one will prevail? Will it be Paul Ainsworth with monkfish `Two Showings; Nathan Outlaw with mackerel, horseradish and oyster sauce; or Simon Hulstone with `The Swimming Pool?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their main course, but which chef will take gold? Will it be Paul Ainsworth with `Wishful Chicken; Nathan Outlaw with duck, barbecue monkfish, rosemary, samphire and asparagus; or Simon Hulstone with lamb with salted toffee pea mousse, shallot puree and asparagus?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the chefs final chance to impress the veteran with their dessert dishes. Will it be Paul Ainsworth with `Then and Now; Nathan Outlaw with elderflower and lemon tart, with strawberry sorbet and meringues; or Simon Hulstone with `Closing Ceremony?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its decision time on Great British Menu for the chefs from the South West region. One chef left the competition on the previous day and only two remain to cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges arent easily pleased and only world class cooking will do.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The 2012 competition enters its final week. The winners of the regional heats compete for a chance for their dish to be on the final banquet menu at a prestigious event hosted by Sir Steve Redgrave with a glittering guest list of British Olympians. Here, the finalists cook their starters, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu judges and veteran judge Richard Corrigan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The eight winners of the regional heats prepare to cook their fish dishes, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu judges and veteran judge Marcus Wareing. Before they get into the kitchen, they must first learn whether they will all be cooking.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: On day three, the chosen finalists cook their main courses, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu judges and veteran judge Tom Kerridge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its desserts day in the finals, and the last chance for the competing chefs to impress the judges and veteran Angela Hartnett. After a hard-fought week, the end of this programme will see the judges finally reveal the winning four dishes which will make up this years `Great British Menu.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This final programme follows the successful chefs in the run-up to the Olympic banquet at the Old Royal Naval College in Greenwich, as they make the painstaking preparations for what is one of the most important meals they will ever cook. The four winning chefs prepare an outstanding four-course menu for a truly Olympian guest list.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Stevie McLaughlin, Jacqueline ODonnell and Neil Rankin go head to head to represent Scotland. Today they must impress the mystery veteran judge with their starter courses.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Scottish chefs, double Michelin starred Stevie McLaughlin, experienced Jacqueline ODonnell and newcomer Neil Rankin fight it out for the fish course.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the main course for Scottish chefs Stevie McLaughlin, Jacqueline ODonnell and Neil Rankin. With the scores close, the pressure is on for all three and theyre each hoping to impress with unique and individual dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the dessert course and the Scottish chefs fates hang in the balance as at the end of today, one of them must be sent home. For Stevie McLaughlin, Jacqueline ODonnell and Neil Rankin theres no room for error.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Lucy visit a three-bedroom detached property in Chatham in Kent, a terraced house in Blythe and a Georgian semi-detached house in Camberwell. All of these properties have been sold at auction and well find out who bought them.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Lucy visit a charming cottage in Stockton-on-Tees, a semi-detached house in Bexleyheath, Kent and a commercial unit in Dartmouth, Devon. All of these properties have been sold at auction and well find out who bought them.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A terraced house in Burnely in Lancashire, a bungalow on a big plot in Paddock Wood in Kent and a semi in Chaddesden in Derby all go under the hammer.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A large barn in Upwell in Norfolk, a period property in Folkestone in Kent and a house in Chesterton in Newcastle-under-Lyme are all in need of major TLC.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Lucy look around a trio of terraces in Stoke, Whitstable in Kent and the former mining village of Penrhiwceiber in Wales.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Two friends who buy a house in Cumbrias Maryport discover a bonus room they never knew existed. Elsewhere developers tackle a terraced house in Burton-upon-Trent, while in Deal in Kent an ambitious redevelopment of an ambulance hall gets under way.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A mid-terrace house near Birmingham, a flat in Londons vibrant Maida Hill and a bit of land in Scotlands historic Dunfermline catch the attention of property developers who have grand ideas - but will they go according to plan?

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A former railway workers cottage in Feniton in Devon, a terraced house in Cobridge in Stoke and a former Methodist chapel in Somercotes in Derbyshire are all sold under the hammer.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Lucy visit a house in Congleton in Cheshire, a one bedroom flat in Willesden in London and a former ambulance station in Port Talbot in Wales.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: An enormous semi in Rotherham, an impressive former chapel in Fraddon in Cornwall and a tiny terraced house in Putney in London go under the hammer.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy looks at a one-bedroom flat next to a train line in London with a hefty guide price, while Martin meets a father and son team working on a two-bedroom terrace in Abertillary. He also visits a pair of semis in Walderslade in Kent.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy meets a primary school teacher with a basement flat in East Dulwich in London, while Martin meets property developers in Ebbw Vale in Wales and Workington in Cumbria - both of whom have ambitious plans for kitchens and bathrooms.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Its a family affair for all three property projects in Port Talbot, Wimbledon and Telford. A father and daughter, cousins and a father and his two stepsons tackle projects bought at auction from just over £20,000 to more than £1.2 million.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy enjoys a day by the seaside visiting a two bedroom maisonette a few steps from the water in Kents Leysdown-on-Sea, while Martin has a look at a terraced house in Cymmer in the Welsh Valleys and a two bedroom mid-terrace in Penkhull near Stoke.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin looks around a terraced house in West Bromwich and another in Telford, while Lucy checks on progress 18-months after she first visited a bungalow on a large plot near Gillingham in Kent.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin visits a two-bedroom flat in Budleigh Salterton and a three-bed terrace in Downpatrick, Northern Ireland, which needs a new lease of life. Lucy meets the buyer of a plot of land in Abbey Wood, London, who has big plans for its future.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy catches up with a developer she met three years ago. This time he has an ambitious project turning two flats in a Victorian house in Hounslow into three. Martin meets two first-time developers working on projects in Glasgow and Tipton.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A flat in Edinburgh, a 1930s terraced house packed full with original features in Bromley in Kent and a five-bedroom house in Exeter in danger of falling down are all sold under the hammer.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A smart looking terrace with an expensive problem to fix in Pontygwaith in Wales, a large Victorian house in Okehampton in Devon and an old pub in Sittingbourne in Kent all go under the hammer.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin visits a listed shop in Hodnet in Shropshire and a property developer working on a maisonette in Ferndale in South Wales. Lucy follows a five-year project to restore a 17th-century listed building in Margate in Kent.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Lucy go flat-tastic looking around buildings which developers hope will create around a dozen flats. The properties sold under the hammer are in Stoke in Staffordshire, Bexleyheath in Kent and Gunnislake in Cornwall.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A five-bedroom house in Plymouth, a two-bed Victorian cottage in Croydon and a former coach house in Cardiff are sold under the hammer. Martin and Lucy meet the developers to hear about their plans to make the most of their auction buys.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A five-bedroom house in Plymouth, a two-bed Victorian cottage in Croydon and a former coach house in Cardiff are sold under the hammer. Martin and Lucy meet the developers to hear about their plans to make the most of their auction buys.

programme.title: Murder Decoded
programme.desc: A car is set on fire near a beach and detectives quickly find the body of a young woman. But, the killers attempt to hide evidence leads police straight to them.

programme.title: Murder in the Heartland
programme.desc: Bubbly college student and waitress, Mindy Morgenstern, is found strangled and stabbed in her own apartment. Family, friends, and the entire town of Valley City, North Dakota help law enforcement identify who could have committed this violent crime.

programme.title: Murder in the Heartland
programme.desc: When twentysomething Patricia Richmond is found tied up, and murdered in her future in-laws home, the resort town of Steamboat Springs, Colorado is at a loss. Who would have taken this bride-to-bes life in such a brutal way?

programme.title: People Magazine Investigates

Downton Abbey is hosting a lavish Christmas party, yet despite it being the season of goodwill, tensions are rife and Batess arrest has cast a shadow over the festivities. programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: During a masterclass for talented young musicians held by famous pianist Sir Michael Fielding, prodigy Zoe Stock is shocked to witness a woman drowning in the river, leaving a baby on the bank. programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol

programme.title: Africas Deadliest

programme.title: Yukon Vet
programme.desc: A routine calf castration surgery turns dangerous.

programme.title: Hostile Planet

programme.title: Ali Brice: I tried to be funny but you werent looking
programme.desc: Ali Brice embraces his life after almost losing it. Three years on, hes admitted defeat and is back on his feet and trying again. Through therapy, friends and the magic of sausages.

programme.title: Will Duggan - Iceberg
programme.desc: Comedys miserable, cheeky scamp is returning with the weight of the world across his shoulders.

programme.title: President Obonjo: Goodbye Mr President
programme.desc: The 55 year old dictator has been leading a covert revolution, with deadpan humour and banging punchlines, maybe the revolution is on its way.

programme.title: Nikki Carr: I Wish These Were Jokes
programme.desc: Comedian Nikki Carr takes to the stage for a night of stand up comedy with jokes about losing weight on the stress diet, the difficulty of dating in 2021 and working the graveyard shift.

programme.title: Myles Weber: Pug Life
programme.desc: Myles Weber performs a standup set about his life experiences and three-legged pug.

programme.title: Lisa Gilbert: All the Time Tired
programme.desc: Comedian Lisa Gilbert performs a standup set.

programme.title: Rex Havens: Women and Children First
programme.desc: Rex has been delighting comedy audiences for 20 years, in world-famous comedy clubs like The Improv, Catch-A-Rising Star, Funny Bones and Zanies, on television for Showtime, Comedy Central and Comic Relief, on radio with Bob and Tom and NPR, cruise ships worldwide, and corporate clients including GM, American Express, Texaco, 3M, Coca-Cola, IBM, Toshiba.

programme.title: Lamont Ferguson: You Had All Day
programme.desc: Ferguson has appeared on the Tonight Show, Comedy Central, Comics Unleashed and ABCs Family Channel. He was the Winner of the Seattle International Comedy Competition, Three time semi-finalist at the Boston Comedy Festival, Finalist in the San Francisco International Comedy Competition and named ÄòBest of FestÄù at the Detroit, Lucky Eagle and San Luis Obispo Comedy Festivals.

programme.title: Jordan Makin: The BFFG (The Big Fat Funny Ginger)
programme.desc: How Jordan Makin compensated for his red hair and uneventful childhood by learning to be funny.

programme.title: Jeff Big Daddy Wayne: Big Daddy Kicks It!
programme.desc: Comedian Jeff Wayne was dubbed `Big Daddy by Billy Crystal and Robin Williams on an HBO Comic Relief show. The moniker has stuck to a guy whos been part of the stand-up comedy scene for a long time.

programme.title: Heath Harmison: Raising Insanity
programme.desc: Comedian Heath Harmison does celebrity impersonations,sings, dances and does accents.

programme.title: David Crowe: White Bread
programme.desc: David Crowe is a 20 year veteran of the comedy stage. He won both the Seattle and San Francisco Comedy Competitions and has performed for a US President.

programme.title: Warren B. Hall: Mostly Kid Stuff
programme.desc: Simply put, Warren B Hall is not what the viewer is expecting. He purposely avoids using the white vs black angle done by many mainstream black comedians.

programme.title: Tyler Boeh: Wait for It
programme.desc: Going from being a mild-mannered nationally recognised college a cappella group vocal percussionist to becoming a high-energy, intelligent, physical, and downright silly beatboxing comedian.

programme.title: Tom Foss: Walking Shoes
programme.desc: Tom Foss has travelled around the world entertaining troops. Including five tours to Iraq, six tours of Afghanistan, eleven tours of the middle east, four tours of Europe, three tours of the Far East, Greenland, five aircraft carriers, support ships and bases all around the United States.

programme.title: Sam Adams: Incoherently True
programme.desc: Smooth. Clever. Hilarious. These words are often used to describe Sam Adams as a comedian, public speaker and master of ceremonies.

programme.title: Brian Moote: Getting Schooled
programme.desc: Brian Moote started performing stand up in 2005 while he was working as a teacher in the Seattle School District.

programme.title: Brandon Vestal: Who?
programme.desc: Brandon Vestals low key, deeply personal and honest style has made him a fast favourite in the comedy world.

programme.title: Ian Smith: Half Life
programme.desc: Narrative stand-up show from comedian Ian Smith, who doesnt do half measures - theres love, theres stress, theres a disabled pigeon... and theres a holiday in Chernobyl.

programme.title: Juliette Burton: Defined
programme.desc: Juliette Burton goes on her journey of self discovery (and mental health recovery) in asking: why cant we be everything at once?

programme.title: Pete Heat: Blimey
programme.desc: Lanky urban wizard Pete Heat uses comedy and mind-blowing tricks to explore that most divisive of subjects: magic itself. Whether it is a visceral experience that loosens ones grasp on reality or a dated, cliche-riddled embarrassment, is TBD.

programme.title: Kiri Pritchard McLean: Hysterical Woman
programme.desc: Welsh-born comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean asks "Why is female treated as a genre?"

programme.title: Anna Mann: A Sketch Show for Depressives
programme.desc: Colin Hoult stars as his alter-ego Ms Anna Mann in a hilarious series of sketches..

programme.title: Phil Kay: Live at the Museum of Comedy
programme.desc: Fun fuelled fast wordy riffage, instant Philosophies, ramblings and improvised singer-songwriting is on the menu as mythic Scottish psychedelic raconteur Phil Kay performs.

programme.title: Max and Ivan: Con Artists
programme.desc: Six ex-cons, one final job. All are reunited by the Ringleader to conduct one final sting - taking down a sinister oligarch.

programme.title: Brennan Reece: Everglow
programme.desc: With boyish energy and a beaming smile, the ever-engaging Brennan Reece is an unstoppable force. The comedian shares a beautifully woven story featuring insights with family at the heart.

programme.desc: Madame Gazelle shows Peppa and her school friends how to make a time capsule, with each of them putting one of their favourite things in the capsule and burying it in the school garden.

programme.desc: When Peppa and George go to the dentist for a check-up, Dr Elephant says their teeth are nice and white, but Georges toy dinosaur is in need of a tooth-clean.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa loves secrets, so Mummy Pig makes her a special box to put secret things in.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Chloe has a new puppet theatre and she helps Peppa and George to make puppets. After lunch, they put on a very funny puppet show about a pig who snores a lot, but Daddy Pig and Uncle Pig miss the show, theyre far too busy snoring.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa is on a play date with Candy Cat at Mr Cats Cafe. Candy show Mr Cat the drawings theyve done of everyone, and he hangs them up for everyone to see.

programme.desc: Peppa and the gang sail on a canal boat.

programme.desc: Peppa and her playgroup friends go with Madame Gazelle to visit Pedro Pony, who is poorly in hospital.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig pops round with some seeds for Peppa and George to plant, with Daddy Pig helping out - by acting as a scarecrow.

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Zoe Zebra delivers a very special letter for Peppa and George: an invitation to her birthday party.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: When Daddy Pig loses his glasses he gets a bit grumpy, but Peppa and George have lots of fun looking for them.

programme.desc: Barnaby Elfs uncle, Redbeard the Elf Pirate, comes to visit the Little Kingdom, but he has lost his treasure. Everyone must help Redbeard track down the treasure.

programme.title: Ben and Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Naughty Gaston is sent to pet school, where Miss Jolly soon gets him into shape.

programme.title: Ben and Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The children are at the Elf Farm, but to learn where milk comes from they must visit a big farm, to find cows. They travel to Lucy Bigs farm, where she shows them all the animals.

programme.title: Ben and Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly is left in charge when King and Queen Thistle go away on important business, but ruling the Little Kingdom isnt as easy as it looks.

programme.title: Ben and Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Lucys dad is digging up the meadow and the Little Kingdom is in danger. How can they stop him without being discovered?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: During a picnic in her garden, cousin Chloe shows Peppa and George fun things to do with flowers.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family are at the swimming pool. George is a little worried at first, but is soon splashing happily with his friend Richard Rabbit.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are playing in the garden with their bouncy ball when Suzy Sheep turns up with two tennis rackets. She uses the bouncy ball to play a game of tennis with Peppa, making George feel left out. Will the job of ball boy cheer him up?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Granny and Grandpa Pig bury treasure in their garden, and Mummy and Daddy Pig help Peppa and George to find it using a special map.

programme.desc: Peppa brings home a teddy from playgroup to look after, but she is worried that he will not have a very exciting time.

programme.desc: Peppas family is staying at Cousin Chloes house. Its been a long day and everyone is tired and sleepy, but baby Alexander keeps everyone awake with his crying.

programme.desc: Madame Gazelle teaches the children how to play the recorder. They practise a lot at home, then put on a performance for all the parents to enjoy.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Foundlings are people who were abandoned as babies, often in the first hours and days of their lives. Born without a trace, they have had no way to unlock the secrets of their past. By combining new DNA technology with painstaking detective work, the mysteries of people with unknown beginnings who are desperate for answers can now be solved. Presented by Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell, the team behind `Long Lost Family use an extraordinary new technique to try and identify birth families and find answers for people who have spent decades trying to find out where they came from.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: A search on behalf of Kate Brown from Portsmouth takes on twists and turns and unveils one missing relative after another. Kate Brown with a foster family and the closest thing she had to a blood relative was her foster brother John who she was very close to but while Kate was eventually adopted by the foster family John was sent back to the care system. Ever since Kate has been on a mission to find him and during her research she made an unexpected discovery.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: A man whose only memento of his birth mother and siblings is an old local newspaper article, which shows them evicted from their home and squatting in an airfield. A mother searching for her only child, who she hasnt seen since he was ten days old.

programme.title: The Great Songwriters

programme.title: Discovering Music

programme.title: Discovering Music

programme.title: Classic FM Live: A Film Music Spectacular
programme.desc: The Bournemouth Symphony Orchestra and the Ukranian conductor Kirill Karabits perform popular film themes from The Royal Albert Hall including Star Wars, Jurassic Park and many more.
