programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: An ingenious plan to get rid of a gluttonous woman goes horribly wrong.

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: An adulterous orchid lover cares more for his flowers than his wife. When presented with a job in America, he thinks it the ideal opportunity to get rid of her through dastardly means.

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: After embezzling $200,000, a man turns himself in to the authorities but refuses to return the money.

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: When a friend (Barry Gordon) is killed, a man (John Craven) reminisces about an incident in their past. With Dennis Patrick.

programme.title: The Directors
programme.desc: A look at the life and career of the Academy Award-winning director, whose films include `The Godfather franchise and `Apocalypse Now.

programme.title: Andre Rieu: Welcome to My World
Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: An amiable swindler gets more than he bargained for when he buys a painting from a sweet old lady. Can she really be as naïve about the pictures worth as she seems?

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: Two men are locked in a room together, and one is shot, but there is no sign of a gun.

programme.title: David Hockney
programme.desc: In Normandy: David Hockney discusses his life and work with Melvyn Bragg in his Normandy studio, revealing his influences, inspirations and plans to keep on painting.

programme.title: Portrait Artist of the Year
programme.sub-title: Si King, Elif Shafak, Joe Marler
programme.desc: Artists from across the UK and Ireland compete in a battle of skill as they attempt to produce portraits of famous sitters. The winner will receive a £10,000 prize, along with their winning portrait being hung in a famous cultural institution.

programme.title: The Directors
programme.desc: A look at the life and career of the Academy Award-winning director, whose films include `Alien, `Blade Runner, `Thelma and Louise, `Gladiator and `Hannibal.

programme.title: Discovering Film
programme.desc: A look into the life of the British star, known for his portrayal of Severus Snape in the `Harry Potter film franchise among many other notable roles.

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: Gossip columnist Lionel Brewster lets fly with his witty one-liners and his victims want revenge. Luckily two young actors, down on their luck, are on hand to offer their clients much more than they bargained for.

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.sub-title: A Girl Cant Always Have Everything
programme.desc: Two struggling theatre actresses have very different off-stage personas. Suzy is a gold-digger who soon begins milking the theatres new backer for expensive gifts, but when he then wants to marry her, she calls on her more mild-mannered friend Pat for help. How loyal is she?

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: A businessman (John McIntire) has second thoughts about having picked up a young hitchhiker (Robert Morse). With Suzanne Pleshette.

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: A son (George Grizzard) encourages his controlling mother (Patricia Collinge) to join her dead husband.

programme.title: Andre Rieu: La Vie Est Belle
programme.desc: Dutch violinist Andre Rieu brings his orchestra to an atmospheric Berlin amphitheatre, with musical favourites like Ravels Bolero, Laras Theme from `Doctor Zhivago and Auld Lang Syne.

programme.title: Andre Rieu: Magic Of Maastricht
programme.desc: Andre Rieu is joined by his Johann Strauss Orchestra as he heads home to Maastricht to perform in front of thousands of fans in the towns historic square.

programme.title: The Phantom of the Opera at the Royal Albert Hall
programme.desc: A recording of the 25th Anniversary Gala Performance of "The Phantom of the Opera" is filmed at Royal Albert Hall.

programme.title: Inside Art
programme.desc: Kate Bryan explores temporary art exhibitions at galleries and cultural venues in the UK. Examine the curatorial decisions being made at institutions as well as focusing on the artists themselves.

programme.title: Arts Most
programme.desc: Award winning art critic Waldemar Januszczak explores three of arts most controversial and important subjects in a hair-raising international journey.

programme.title: John Malkovich: Just Call Me God
programme.desc: This musical drama stars John Malkovich as a crazed dictator on his last legs who delivers a powerful monologue accompanied by the music of Bach, Franck, Widor, Messiaen and Ligeti.

programme.desc: This musical drama stars John Malkovich as a crazed dictator on his last legs who delivers a powerful monologue accompanied by the music of Bach, Franck, Widor, Messiaen and Ligeti.

programme.title: Arts Uncovered
programme.desc: A collection of shorts that go deeper into the world of art and the people behind it.

programme.title: Auction
programme.desc: The art collection of late pop superstar George Michael goes under the hammer at Christies in a special auction featuring works by Tracey Emin, Damien Hirst and Bridget Riley.

programme.title: Pompeii
programme.desc: As Mount Vesuvius rains down lava and ash, a gladiator (Kit Harington) races to save the woman (Emily Browning) he loves before the city collapses.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Antiheroes
programme.desc: From Dirty Harry and The Godfather to the deeply imperfect gang from the Fast and the Furious franchise, this Cinema List celebrates our favourite anti-heroes.

programme.title: Shooter
programme.desc: Following the death of his friend, Bobby decides to leave the army but he is soon asked to come back into action in order to help prevent the assassination of the President.

programme.title: Vendetta
programme.desc: When his daughter is brutally murdered and legal justice looks unlikely, William Duncan takes the law into his own hands, setting out on a quest for retribution.

programme.title: Street Fighter
programme.desc: The cynical commander of Allied Nations forces has to prevent a warlord from taking over the world. With 63 hostages held in his seemingly impregnable fortress, the warlord is demanding an outrageously hefty ransom.

programme.title: Black Hawk Down
programme.desc: Based on the botched mission during Americas military involvement in Somalia in the early 1990s. An attempt by US Army Rangers parachuted into Mogadishu to capture a warlords two top lieutenants goes disastrously wrong when two helicopters are shot down.

programme.title: Shooter
programme.desc: Following the death of his friend, Bobby decides to leave the army but he is soon asked to come back into action in order to help prevent the assassination of the President.

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: The evil mummy Imhotep returns to wreak havoc as he resumes his relentless search for power and immortality. To make matters worse, another ancient evil has been unleashed, even more dangerous than Imhotep. Only the heroic Rick OConnell and his intrepid Egyptologist wife stand in the way of these twin terrors as they embark upon a desperate mission to save the world.

programme.title: The Scorpion King
programme.desc: In a time before the pyramids, an evil king threatens to take over the world, so the leaders of the remaining tribes under threat call upon a desert warrior to help them defeat the wicked one and his brutal hordes. As the warrior battles against the evil around him, he is preparing for a final showdown that will decide if it is to be his destiny to become the great Scorpion King.

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom
programme.desc: Adventure sequel. Intrepid archaeologist Indiana Jones, on the trail of fortune and glory in Old Shanghai, is ricocheted into a dangerous adventure in India. With his faithful companion Short Round and nightclub singer Willie Scott, Indie goes in search of the magical Sankara stone, and uncovers an ancient evil which threatens all who come into contact with it.

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
programme.desc: The intrepid explorer Indiana Jones sets out to rescue his father, a medievalist who has vanished while searching for the Holy Grail. Following clues in the old mans notebook, Indy arrives in Venice, where he enlists the help of a beautiful academic, but they are not the only ones who are on the trail, and some sinister old enemies soon come out of the woodwork.

programme.title: Street Fighter
programme.desc: The cynical commander of Allied Nations forces has to prevent a warlord from taking over the world. With 63 hostages held in his seemingly impregnable fortress, the warlord is demanding an outrageously hefty ransom.

programme.title: The Dark Tower
programme.desc: Roland Deschain, the last Gunslinger, must prevent the Man in Black from toppling the Dark Tower, the key that holds the universe together.

programme.title: The Green Hornet
programme.desc: The heir to a newspaper fortune joins forces with a resourceful company employee to try to bring a powerful Los Angeles crime lord to justice.

programme.title: The Green Hornet
programme.desc: The heir to a newspaper fortune joins forces with a resourceful company employee to try to bring a powerful Los Angeles crime lord to justice.

programme.title: Spirit: Stallion of the Cimarron
programme.desc: The story of a wild mustang stallion captured by horse traders and sold to a cavalry regiment at a frontier outpost, where a cruel colonel attempts to break the free-spirited horse. However, he escapes in the company of a Native American youth and embarks upon a series of adventures in the harsh and unforgiving times of the Old West.

programme.title: The Road to El Dorado
programme.desc: Two rogues stumble across a map of the treasures of El Dorado and stow away on an explorers ship bound for South America, where they are mistaken for gods due to their foreign complexions. Narrated by Elton John, who provided the music to Tim Rices lyrics.

programme.title: Sinbad: Legend of the Seven Seas
programme.desc: The brave mariner Sinbad battles raging elements, mutinous dogs and fearsome monsters to retrieve the Book of Peace after being framed by the treacherous Goddess of Chaos. A DreamWorks animation.

programme.title: The Wild Thornberrys Movie
programme.desc: A feature-length spin-off from the TV series, the Thornberry family - led by natural history film-maker Colonel Radcliff Thornberry - head to deepest Africa. Once there, daughter Eliza - after meeting a shaman - can talk to the animals, a skill that stands her in good stead to foil a dastardly plot by poachers to kill a herd of elephants for their ivory.

programme.title: The Pirates! In an Adventure With Scientists
programme.desc: An inept swashbuckler decides to make an attempt to win the Pirate of the Year Award, and beat his rivals Black Bellamy and Cutlass Liz in a race to plunder the most booty. His journey takes him to Victorian London where the Pirate Captain must choose between winning Pirate of the Year, or helping his crew.

programme.title: The Ogglies
programme.desc: Young Max meets the Ogglies, a family of green, garbage-eating creatures who live at the dump in the town of Smelliville. When a contractor plans to build a wellness temple at the dump, Max and his pal must hatch a plan to save the Ogglies home.

programme.title: Open Season 3
programme.desc: After Boog switches places with a circus bear, Elliott and the gang must rescue him before the circus returns home to Russia.

programme.title: Sing
programme.desc: A pig, a mouse, a porcupine, a gorilla, an elephant and other animals gather at a koalas theatre for a singing competition.

programme.title: Happy Feet
programme.desc: Son of Memphis and Norma, little sweet penguin Mumble has a big problem: he cant sing a single note. In a world where everyone needs a heart song to attract a soul mate, Mumble feels he doesnt belong there. Our hero Mumble is the worst singer in the world, but he can tap dance brilliantly.

programme.title: Happy Feet Two
programme.desc: Mumbles son Erik hasnt yet found his talents, and he goes with his friends to Adelie-land which is ruled by a penguin who can fly. When Erik returns to Emperor-land and finds them trapped under big walls of ice. Will Erik be able to save his family and friends before it is too late?

programme.title: Penguins of Madagascar
programme.desc: The plucky penguins join a special inter-species task force in an attempt to stop an evil doctor from taking over the world.

programme.title: Migration
programme.desc: A family of ducks decides to leave the safety of a New England pond for an adventurous trip to Jamaica. However, their well-laid plans quickly go awry when they get lost and wind up in New York City.

programme.title: The Road to El Dorado
programme.desc: Two rogues stumble across a map of the treasures of El Dorado and stow away on an explorers ship bound for South America, where they are mistaken for gods due to their foreign complexions. Narrated by Elton John, who provided the music to Tim Rices lyrics.

programme.title: Sinbad: Legend of the Seven Seas
programme.desc: The brave mariner Sinbad battles raging elements, mutinous dogs and fearsome monsters to retrieve the Book of Peace after being framed by the treacherous Goddess of Chaos. A DreamWorks animation.

programme.title: Over the Hedge
programme.desc: An opportunistic raccoon teaches fellow animals about the edible treasures that the new humans in the neighbourhood conveniently leave outdoors.

programme.title: Deep Sea
programme.desc: Swept into the sea during a family cruise, a young girl named Shenxiu stumbles upon a mysterious restaurant under the waves. There, she meets the scheming head chef and his ragtag crew of adorable otters and sarcastic walruses.

programme.title: Deep Sea
programme.desc: Swept into the sea during a family cruise, a young girl named Shenxiu stumbles upon a mysterious restaurant under the waves. There, she meets the scheming head chef and his ragtag crew of adorable otters and sarcastic walruses.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: Scott Pilgrim plays bass guitar in a struggling Toronto-based band and pines after his ex-girlfriend, now a success in her own band. At a party he meets Ramona Flowers and instantly is smitten, but in his pursuit of her he is attacked by Matthew Patel who informs Scott that he is the first of seven evil exes that Scott will have to defeat in order to win Ramona.

programme.title: You, Me and Dupree
programme.desc: Carl is in seventh heaven when he marries his gorgeous girlfriend Molly in Hawaii. After a blissful honeymoon, they get back to find best man Dupree jobless, penniless and homeless. When Carl offers him a place to crash, he has no idea of the havoc that the blonde bum is about to cause.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds
programme.desc: Deeds is much-loved in his small town, but following the death of a long-lost uncle, who also happens to be a billionaire tycoon, Deeds inherits a fortune and heads for the big city to run his uncles company. When a media frenzy ensues surrounding Deeds inheritance, reporter Babe Bennett goes undercover to out Deeds as the small-town fool she thinks he is.

programme.title: The Nutty Professor
programme.desc: Professor Sherman, a 450lb scientist, falls for his new colleague Professor Carla Purty, but out on a date, hes humiliated by a nightclub comedian about his weight. Upset and depressed, he takes a potion hes only tested previously on hamsters and - hey presto - he turns into a svelte and cool-talking babe-magnet, Buddy Love.

programme.title: Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
programme.desc: Sherman is getting married to Denise Gains but his alter-ego Buddy Love keeps breaking through. Determined to rid himself of his pesky partner, he extracts Buddys genes, but an accident and a dog hair see Buddy take on his own life. Unaware of his existence, Sherman and Denise perfect their new rejuvenation formula and their fortune seems assured until Buddy steals it.

programme.title: 50 First Dates
programme.desc: Playboy vet Henry sets his heart on romancing Lucy, but she has short-term memory loss; she cant remember anything that happened the day before. So every morning, Henry has to woo her again. Her friends and family are very protective, and Henry must convince them that hes in it for love.

programme.title: Crazy Rich Asians
programme.desc: Rachel Chu is happy to accompany her longtime boyfriend, Nick, to his best friends wedding in Singapore. Shes also surprised to learn that Nicks family is extremely wealthy and hes considered one of the countrys most eligible bachelors. Thrust into the spotlight, Rachel must now contend with jealous socialites, quirky relatives and something far, far worse: Nicks disapproving mother.

programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: Forced to spend Christmas break with a handful of students, a curmudgeonly instructor at a New England prep school develops an unlikely bond with a brainy troublemaker and the head cook.

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 3
programme.desc: After the highs of winning the world championships, the Bellas find themselves split apart. But when they get the chance to reunite for an overseas USO tour, this group of awesome nerds will come together to make some music one last time.

programme.title: Billy Madison
programme.desc: Billy is the son of hotel chain magnate Brian Madison and expects to inherit the family fortune, but hes shocked when his father stipulates he wont unless he passes 12th grade in just 24 weeks. It will be tough, since he never passed 1st grade. Determined to prove his father wrong, Billy enrols at school.

programme.title: Twins
programme.desc: Two very different twin brothers were born as a result of a genetic experiment. Following their birth, the flawless Julius grew up on a paradise island, while the less-than-perfect Vincent was sent to an orphanage. Now, many years later, Vincent is a thief and con man with huge debts. What will Julius think when he searches for his long-lost twin and finds him in jail?

programme.title: Alfie
programme.desc: In an update of the 1966 Lewis Gilbert version, the eponymous Alfie is transposed to Manhattan and working as a chauffeur. His conquests include older woman Liz, lonely Nikki and Lonette, his best friends girl. However, he begins to learn bitter truths about himself and the way he treats women and, by the end of the film, he discovers a degree of humility.

programme.title: Nacho Libre
programme.desc: Brother Ignacio is an orphanage chef who cooks up a plan to earn money for the kids by becoming a Mexican wrestling star. First, he must don a leotard.

programme.title: Nacho Libre
programme.desc: Brother Ignacio is an orphanage chef who cooks up a plan to earn money for the kids by becoming a Mexican wrestling star. First, he must don a leotard.

programme.title: Flashdance
programme.desc: A young female welder dreams of becoming a professional dancer and struggles against all the odds to realise her dream. However, in her effort to succeed, she discovers that getting to the top is far from easy. Giorgio Moroders composition `Flashdance (What a Feeling), sung by Irene Cara, won an Academy Award for Best Original Song.

programme.title: Dear John
programme.desc: Whilst on leave, a Marine falls in love with a college student. The long-distance relationship is then tested when the Marine decides to re-enlist post-9/11.

programme.title: There Will Be Blood
programme.desc: Ruthless silver miner, turned oil prospector, Daniel Plainview moves to oil-rich California. Using his adopted son HW to project a trustworthy, family-man image, Plainview cons local landowners into selling him their valuable properties for a pittance. However, local preacher Eli Sunday suspects Plainviews motives and intentions, starting a slow-burning feud that threatens both their lives.

programme.title: Elizabeth: The Golden Age
programme.desc: Elizabeth might have her royal rival Mary Queen of Scots in custody, but a far greater threat lies to the east: the Spanish Armada. Despite her reign of 30 years, Elizabeths hold on the English throne remains uncertain. Her kingdom lies in the shadow of mighty Spain, Philip IIs vast army and the Inquisition, but Elizabeth is undaunted.

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Weaving in and out of the love lives of eight loosely inter-related couples. The bachelor Prime Minister falls for his personal assistant, his brother-in-law is flirting with one of his colleagues, a writer heads off to France and pursues an affair with a maid, and an 11-year-old boy asks his father for advice on matters of the heart.

programme.title: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas
programme.desc: When his fathers job results in a family move to the countryside, young German boy Bruno misses his old friends. Roaming the grounds of the large country house he now calls home, he discovers the huge fenced facility that his dad Ralf, a Nazi officer, now manages. Approaching it, Bruno meets Shmuel, a fellow youngster on the other side of the barbed wire, wearing what appears to be a pair of pyjamas.

programme.title: Dreamgirls
programme.desc: Following the adventures of The Dreamettes, an all-girl singing group. Theyre going nowhere fast until they meet fast-talking car salesman-come-manager who has ambitions to make a fortune selling black music to a white audience. He persuades them to become backing singers for James `Thunder Early, but the larger-than-life lead singer Effie White must step out of the spotlight in favour of the more image-friendly Deena Jones.

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: High-spirited musical set in 1950s America, in which a girl and boy who met on the beach are unexpectedly reunited at high school. She cannot understand how different he has become. Can the leather-clad, tough-talking leader of the T-Birds really be the same person? Perhaps her new friends, the Pink Ladies, can help her win back his heart?

programme.title: Joker: Folie à Deux

programme.title: Amadeus
programme.desc: Once the highly regarded composer to the Viennese Court, Salieri is now an old man, unknown and confined to an asylum. After a suicide attempt he recounts his story to a young cleric, going back 30 years to his heyday at the court of Emperor Joseph II, where he first met the young Mozart. Despite Salieris Machiavellian attempts to frustrate Mozarts progress, the great young composer attracts the favour of the Emperor.

programme.title: Calvary
programme.desc: An honest and good-hearted priest wrestles with a cynical and spiteful community after he receives a death threat from an unknown parishioner.

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: New York widow Holly is devastated by her husbands sudden demise, but messages he left behind offer a ray of hope.

programme.title: Johnny English
programme.desc: Spoof spy caper with the eponymous, blundering hero attempting to recover the crown jewels and save Britain from an evil mastermind when all the other agents are killed. Promoted from lowly pen pusher to super spy, Johnny English is baffled when clues lead to respected entrepreneur Pascal Sauvage, but could the enigmatic Lorna hold the key to the mystery?

programme.title: Save The Cinema

programme.title: Ella Enchanted

His latest assignment finds him travelling to America as an art expert, looking after the famous `Whistlers Mother painting as it is transported from Britain to a posh new Los Angeles museum. The catch is that Bean is no art expert and his trip was a ploy by his British employers to get rid of him. Unfortunately, no one has warned the Americans about Mr Bean.

programme.title: Wicked
programme.desc: An unlikely friendship emerges between Elphaba and Glinda, two clashing witches in the magical land of Oz. Elphaba is wrongfully cast as a wicked witch as she seeks to expose the fraudulent, corrupt Wizard who rules the land.

programme.title: Wonka
programme.desc: Focusing on a young Willy Wonka and how he came to meet the Oompa-Loompas on one of his earliest adventures.

programme.title: Hook

Peter has grown up into a workaholic executive but takes time off for a holiday in London. Once there, his children are kidnapped by Hook, and Peter must throw off his corporate image and go back to Neverland to save his children.

programme.title: Reuniting the Rubins
programme.desc: Uptight lawyer Lenny Rubins has to put his dream retirement on hold when he is emotionally blackmailed into reuniting his estranged children.

programme.title: Oliver!
programme.desc: Endearing film version of Lionel Barts successful stage musical based on Dickenss tale of the fluctuating fortunes of an orphan boy. Ron Moody stands out as the wily old scrounger Fagin in a series of well-crafted set-pieces and atmospheric musical numbers, and a tribe of child stars brings the 19th-century London underworld vividly to life.

programme.title: Housesitter
programme.desc: Newton Davis builds a dream home for his childhood sweetheart and is promptly dumped. Devastated, he seeks solace in the arms of a waitress, but sneaks off into the night once hes had his fun. The spurned waitress exacts her revenge by moving into the empty house and masquerading as Newtons wife. At this stage, things start getting complicated.

programme.title: Clear and Present Danger
programme.desc: Investigating the assassination of a friend of the President, CIA agent Ryan discovers that his friend was in league with the Colombian drugs cartels. In revenge, a paramilitary force is sent in to wipe out the drug lords but when the operation goes wrong, theyre abandoned by their country. Now their only hope is Ryan and fellow renegade operative Clark.

programme.title: Congo

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: Frank is a retired Lt Col in the US army. Hes blind and impossible to get along with. Charlie is at school and is looking forward to going to university; to help pay for a trip home for Christmas, he agrees to look after Frank over thanksgiving. Franks niece says this will be easy money, but she didnt reckon on Frank spending his Thanksgiving in New York.

programme.title: True Grit

programme.title: The Bridges at Toko-Ri

The unlikely pair embark on a voyage of discovery as they become embroiled in the Mexican War.

programme.title: QPR: The Four Year Plan
programme.desc: In 2007 Queens Park Rangers Football Club, facing relegation and bankruptcy, was rescued by four high-profile billionaires. Their vision: to take a community of reluctant fans, semi-talented players and a roster of ever-changing managers to Premiership glory. The new owners, risking ridicule and commercial failure, allowed cameras to record the extraordinary roller-coaster ride.

programme.desc: A subtropical realm of staggering diversity exists on the eastern coast of Africa. A mangrove forest experiences the high and low tides.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Alison attempts to rescue a squirrel monkey, who proves to be something of an escape artist, and the newly arrived orangutan youngster Kayan meets with Bulu Mata for the first time.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: The park comes to the aid of two marmosets, leaving Alison shocked by the condition of the male, while Louisa reaches out the foot of friendship to male crush Matty the capuchin.

programme.title: A Bees Diary
programme.desc: Bees are one of the most important species on the planet. Follow the trials and tribulations of two particular honeybees over two years from birth to death.

programme.title: A Cheetahs Pride
programme.desc: Two Mothers, Nine Cubs: Chilli and her five cubs encounter young mother Inara and her four. See what happens when their standoff resolves into an unusual blended family.

programme.desc: A subtropical realm of staggering diversity exists on the eastern coast of Africa. A mangrove forest experiences the high and low tides.

programme.title: Hope for Wildlife
programme.desc: A handful of weasels are finally ready for release into the wild, a daring volunteer goes offshore to rescue an injured eagle and a gull flies free.

programme.title: Deep Dive North America
programme.desc: Traverse the Canadian rainforest, gaze up at towering redwoods, and explore giant kelp forests with Lizzie as she experiences North Americas wild west coast. Encounter wolves and bears whilst salmon journey upstream to spawn.

programme.title: Gangs Of Baboon Falls
programme.desc: As lockdown continues, the streets of Victoria Falls are empty, and the gangs must find new ways to survive in a strangely changed world.

programme.desc: Bees are one of the most important species on the planet. Follow the trials and tribulations of two particular honeybees over two years from birth to death.

programme.title: A Cheetahs Pride
programme.desc: Two Mothers, Nine Cubs: Chilli and her five cubs encounter young mother Inara and her four. See what happens when their standoff resolves into an unusual blended family.

programme.title: Dogs With Extraordinary Jobs
programme.desc: A Great Dane assists a 13-year-old girl living with a limiting condition and a Border Collie helps the California Task Force search for survivors. Meanwhile Ruger sniffs out illegal poachers in Zambia.

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: At the waters edge a brave group of male penguins gather, preparing to make the dangerous journey ashore. With many threats ahead, there is safety in number and these petite penguins have important business to attend. Its time to breed and they must find a burrow before the females arrive.

programme.title: Gangs Of Baboon Falls
programme.desc: As the Victoria gang struggle with lots of new mouths to feed, the Zambai gang must decide whether to let outcasts from outer town in.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: A challenging trip into the great outdoors awaits some of the lorises from the park, and two black-shanked douc monkeys have quite the adventure in store for them in Vietnam.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Newly arrived squirrel monkey Kimbo has a heath check and also gets the snip, while orangutan youngster Kayan goes outside for the first time.

programme.title: Dogs With Extraordinary Jobs
programme.desc: At a South African airport, bird-chasing Border Collies are preventing potentially devastating collisions with aircraft. In the British countryside a Sprocker Spaniels extraordinary sense of smell are playing a vital life-saving role.

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: New Zealands West Coast is like nowhere else on Earth. From glacier-covered mountains to rain-drenched native forests to rough frigid seas, the landscape defies belief. Isolated from the rest of the world, this strip of almost untouched wilderness hides a host of endemic animals. Evolutionary castaways, every one of them is a rare ecological jewel. From alpine parrots and shy penguins to mammal-like kiwis and ancient eels.

programme.title: The Living Beach
programme.desc: Just beyond Australias Queensland State is Fraser Island, a complex ecosystem built entirely upon sand. In the middle of its rainforests, eucalyptus woodlands and mangrove forests, a visitor to Fraser Island is always standing upon the living beach.

programme.title: Deep Dive North America
programme.desc: Delve into North Americas southern coastal waters, where opalescent squid mate, sea turtles nest, and mobula rays soar in romantic displays. Join Lizzie as she pilots a specialised drone to collect breath samples from blue whales.

programme.title: Charade
programme.desc: A woman returns to her Paris flat to find her estranged husbands body and the CIA demanding answers to some baffling questions. The police are convinced that she knows the whereabouts of the loot.

programme.title: Johnny Ringo
programme.desc: Ringo investigates a brutal stagecoach robbery where the driver and one of the passengers were killed.

programme.title: Look at Life
programme.desc: A look at the various aspects of London Airport with a focus on BOAC and BEA airlines.

programme.title: The Bigamist
programme.desc: Phyllis Martin is one of the two wives of bigamist Harry Graham. When Graham and his other wife decide to adopt a baby, the agencys investigations bring Phylliss existence to light and, through flashback, Graham tells the story of how he ended up married twice.

programme.title: Whats on TPTV with Noel
programme.desc: Founder of Talking Pictures TV and one half of the Footage Detectives, Noel Cronin, shares shows and films not to be missed throughout October.

programme.title: Out of Town
programme.desc: Jack Hargreaves goes pigeon shooting using decoys. He then heads to the river Kennet with some homemade equipment to sample fishing on a budget.

programme.title: The Lost Films of the Kursaal
programme.desc: A collection of films shot by the Kursaal Amusement Park owner Cliffton J. Morehouse providing a unique look at the amusement park in its heyday as seen through the eyes of its charismatic boss.

programme.title: Look at Life
programme.desc: A fascinating look at donkeys and their ever increasing popularity.

programme.title: A Taste Of Money
programme.desc: An elderly spinster plots to rob her employers with the perfect crime!

programme.title: Glimpses
programme.sub-title: Birmingham and The Road Patrol Bikes in the 1950s
programme.desc: We start in Birmingham at the famous BSA factory where we follow the annual Road Patrol. Marvel at their side chassis and box carriers.

programme.title: Dixon of Dock Green
programme.desc: When a petty criminal is fished out of the river bound, gagged and barely conscious, the team must find out what happened and why.

programme.title: The Shop at Sly Corner
programme.desc: A book-keeper for an antiques dealer discovers that his employer is an escaped convict and decides to blackmail him.

programme.title: Look at Life
programme.desc: A look at the railway modernisation schemes taking place and the controversy they have caused.

programme.title: The Painted Smile
programme.desc: A student falls under suspicion of murder after a con artist persuades him to help her get rid of a body. When the student sets out to find the con artist to clear his name, he finds himself in even more trouble.

programme.title: The Beverly Hillbillies
programme.desc: When Jethro misses his graduation from sixth grade due to being late, Skipper the chimp pinch-hits for him.

programme.title: Scotland Yard
programme.desc: A horse rider is found dead in suspicious circumstances.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: The Cartwrights try to end a disabled ranchers dependence on his corrupt hired hand.

programme.title: The Vise
programme.desc: Harry Bancroft loses a fortune. An article exposes Graves insider trading, and he starts to receive threatening letters.

programme.title: The Footage Detectives
programme.desc: Join us on a nostalgic trip on the great Bluebell Railway! We are chugging back to the 60s to watch some footage of the railways restoration. Plus, watch an unearthed interview with Flora Robson!

programme.title: Francis Durbridges Melissa
programme.desc: Stars Peter Barkworth, Ronald Fraser and Joan Benham. Guy Foster refuses to accompany his wife Melissa to a party, only to find that he has been implicated in her murder.

programme.title: Gideons Way
programme.desc: Sir Arthur Vanes fascist V-Party are opposed by the anything but peaceful Peace Party.

programme.title: The Case of the Frightened Lady
programme.desc: Who murdered the young chauffeur? Detective Chief Superintendent Tanner leads the investigation.

programme.title: Cause Celebre
programme.desc: When a womans husband is murdered by her lover, both are tried for murder. The prosecution claims that the woman is the mastermind behind the crime, but she has an ace up her sleeve.

programme.title: A Tale of Five Cities
programme.desc: When an Englishman leaves America to enlist in the RAF, his gruelling combat experiences result in a loss of memory.

programme.title: Desert Mice
programme.desc: Mediocre British entertainers go to Africa to raise troop morale in World War II.

programme.title: Desert Mice
programme.desc: Mediocre British entertainers go to Africa to raise troop morale in World War II.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Seasons
programme.desc: Jamie kicks off autumn with Italian-inspired cheesy cabbage pasta and smoky sweetcorn burgers with feta. He shares tips for storing onions and saving tomato seeds, finishing with a beautiful tomato galette for a perfect fall meal.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver: Fast and Simple
programme.desc: Jamie shares a simple salmon dish perfect for a midweek meal, and some no-fuss fish cakes made from tins. He cooks a lamb Madras traybake, as well as a no-cook pasta sauce, and crowns it all off with a hot and crispy ice cream parcel!

programme.title: Let Frankie Cook
programme.desc: Frankie reunites his old band for a jam session and a spin on a college-era classic - featuring Shoyu Ramen with Tare Eggs, sweet and savory Chicken Meatballs, Seaweed Cucumber Salad, and a crispy Okonomiyaki pancake.

programme.title: Let Frankie Cook
programme.desc: Frankie fuels up for action making hot Oatmeal, and Energy Date Balls, before he cooks up the perfect post-ride feast of cheesy Juicy Lucy Burgers, Ramp-loaded pasta salad, and a maple ginger switchel to cool it all down.

programme.title: Let Frankie Cook
programme.desc: Frankie fires up a steakhouse-style spread with Italian flair from golden beets and buttery mushrooms to a sizzling Bistecca alla Fiorentina steak with salmoriglio sauce, and a smooth cold brew affogato granita.

programme.title: Let Frankie Cook
programme.desc: Frankie explores his Italian roots, pairing each pasta shape with its perfect sauce-from Cavatelli with Super Green Sauce to Pappardelle in pork ragout, ricotta Gnocchi with punchy anchovy pecorino, and cozy Squash Orzotto with bloomed poppy seeds.

programme.title: Let Frankie Cook
programme.sub-title: Pancake Stacks and Snacks for Two
programme.desc: Frankie flips the script for his wife Heather making breakfast for dinner featuring Banana Maple Pancakes, Eggs Benedict with prosciutto cotto, Home Fries with Bloody Mary Ketchup, Sausage Scrapple, and a boozy Espresso Milkshake.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Cabbage has long been an underrated green on the field, and its about time Frankie gives it a starring role. This leafy head proves itself as the versatile ingredient we need it to be, affordable year around, delicious and filling.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Reaching textural nirvana is never easy, but Frankie explores several ways to achieve the perfect crunch in his dishes, both savory and sweet. Add this elusive element to your recipes without adding cost to your budget.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: No veggie family packs the same nutritious punch as the cruciferous family, and with a shelf life this long, theyve become a fixture in Frankies meal rotation. These delicious and easy-to-make recipes will win everyone over in no time.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie throws a game day party for under $25. Game days arent for dinner parties but they are a day for some fan-favorite finger foods, especially those you can make in advance. Frankie makes three no-fuss appetizers.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: The struggle is real, but it doesnt mean your food has to suffer. Chef Frankie Celenza shows you how to make delicious meals that wont break the bank.

programme.title: I Only Cooked Cozy Fall Dinners for a Week
programme.desc: The air is crisp and the leaves are changing, which means its time to gather round the dinner table for hearty, seasonal meals on a budget. These warm dishes are sure to keep you cozy all season long.

programme.title: The Secret Budget Ingredient in These Recipes Is...
programme.desc: Who knew mayo could be such a savvy secret agent? Its a controversial condiment that can unlock the buttery, crispy, decadent codes of our favorite dishes, without leaving a trace of mayo-ness. Best of all, its easy to make at home!

programme.title: I Cooked a Full Meal in 15 Minutes
programme.desc: At the end of a long, hectic day, when you need dinner in a pinch, Frankie unlocks his not-so-secret formula for whipping up quick and easy meals, using minimal ingredients that will satisfy your cravings and feed the family in a flash.

programme.title: The $7 Struggle Meals Challenge
programme.desc: At a loss when your pantry is empty? With these recipes, you can walk into any grocery store with only $7 and walk out with everything you need for an entire meal. Because yes, you can whip up a nutritious meal at an affordable price!

programme.title: I Tried Making Meals With Just 5 Ingredients

programme.title: Struggle Meals

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh visits Grantham to surprise Rob and Margaret Isdale who, now in their 70s, have fostered over 150 vulnerable children in the UK over the last 45 years. The team turn their boring backyard into a spectacular garden inspired by the famous book and film, The Secret Garden. Complete with ancient looking follies and winding paths, the team share tips on how to make even a brand new garden look and feel established and romantic.

programme.title: Edwardian Farm
programme.desc: August brings the climax of the farming year - and the end of 12 months on the Edwardian Farm for the team. Their last challenge is to harvest their oat crop, but everything depends on the weather. To celebrate the end of harvest, the whole town enjoys a grand fete sporting new innovations such as the electric light bulb, the latest threshing machines, the petrol-powered Lister engine and a genuine flying machine.

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Theo Randall and Rachel Allen are in the Herefordshire town of Kington, where they compete against some of the most competitive bakers in the area with their entries for the open fruit tart with sweet pastry category in the Kington Horse and Agricultural Society Show. They also enjoy a visit to the Dunkerton Cider Company.

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Nigella introduces us to her favourite recipes for sharing with family and friends. Whether its a tray of nourishing breakfast bars, crunchy chicken cutlets, or Nigellas sumptuous chocolate cake, every recipe is a guaranteed crowd pleaser.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Thirty-five-year-old career woman Charlene is struggling to come to terms with the fact that shes about to become a mum. Charlenes mum Marion and Aunt Bev use Liverpudlian humour to help her through the final stages of labour.

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: After giving up on men, 34-year-old beautician Maria unexpectedly fell for her builder, David. Lifes plan seems to finally be coming together, but some worrying news about their unborn baby puts their life on hold.

programme.title: Prison Girls
programme.desc: In the jails intake area, women fresh off the streets can be drunk, high or mentally unwell. With inmates detoxing from heroin, crack, and crystal meth, medical emergencies are a regular occurrence.

programme.title: Prison Girls
programme.desc: The jails most violent and antisocial inmates are housed in Ocean, its segregation pod. And, Lo and Kayla go to extreme lengths when their romantic relationship is uncovered and they are separated.

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: Having survived seven tough challenges, this week the two finalists go head-to-head for the ultimate prize. Awaiting the winner is a career-defining contract to design an apartment for an upmarket coastal resort on the Cornish coast. Judge Michelle Ogundehin dispatches the finalists to Londons vibrant Soho district, where each designer takes on the redesign of a trendy bar.

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Following paramedics in Stoke as they respond to a call about a man who has collapsed with severe breathlessness, while in Dudley, crews treat a woman with a host of complex medical issues.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo discovers how Minneapolis harnessed the awesome power of the Mighty Mississippi to become a great industrial centre, the Mill City of the nation. And he finds how the city became the artificial limb capital of the world.

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.sub-title: Red Wing, Minnesota to Portage, Wisconsin
programme.desc: Michael continue his journey along the Mississippi to Red Wing, Minnesota. Picking up the Empire Builder rail service he travels to Winona, where he takes to the water to find out how the US Army Corps of Engineers made the Mississippi navigable.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads to North Yorkshire to pick up a veteran London-to-Brighton car, theres an emotional farewell to a 1980s Bedford HA van, and a Toyota Corona finds a new home.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek gives the once-over to a Royale Formula Ford race car, and Paul is on a marathon trip to Teesside to pick up a 1953 MGYB, a Moggy Van and an 80s Yamaha 250RD motorbike.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: An in-depth exploration of the assassination of one of the main architects of the Holocaust, Reinhard Heydrich, by British-trained Czechs.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head to Cheshire for a day of busy valuations at Arley Hall and Gardens. Combing through the thousands of objects brought in by visitors the experts are excited to discover two different items that have spent many years hidden from view - a gold bracelet found mysteriously bricked up behind a wall that is linked to a tragic love story, and a time capsule, buried in 1886, is opened on camera to reveal its secrets 130 years later.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A return visit to the enchanting gardens of Arley Hall in Cheshire finds Fiona Bruce and the team of experts hard at work. Its a rich day of finds as family treasures come under scrutiny. Amongst the objects featured are a portrait of a visitors mother which was painted in India in the 1950s.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: There is a triple collection of desirable cars in store for Derek when an MG Midget, an Austin-Healey frogeye Sprite and an RS2000 come up for auction.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Daves son Jack is heading out to Cheshire to collect two cars with a 35-year age difference. And luckily for Mathewsons, Lucy knows exactly what has been brought in for auction.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters

programme.title: Operation Arctic with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Kate meets the Inuit artists inspired by the changing world around them, while Simon heads off on a fishing expedition, Arctic style. In Churchill, Gordon finds out how the town deals with their more troublesome bears when he follows the eviction of a repeat offender.

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: On Sri Lanka, the Chinese are building a huge new port and their money has helped the Sri Lankan government bring a 30-year war to a brutal end. Simon Reeve also visits the north of the island - the scene of vicious battles between fighters from the Tamil minority and the Sri Lankan army. Heading north to Bangladesh, Simon investigates one of the Indian Oceans fastest growing industries - providing prawns.

programme.title: The Lakes with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon looks at the impact of humans on Englands biggest and most popular national park. He goes wild swimming in the crystal-clear lake of Buttermere, before taking a look at the less-fortunate Derwent Water.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: There is a triple collection of desirable cars in store for Derek when an MG Midget, an Austin-Healey frogeye Sprite and an RS2000 come up for auction.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Explores an industrial ruin in the Florida Everglades in the south of the United States that once competed in the greatest race humankind has ever witnessed: the mission to land on the Moon.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael begins in the port of Batumi on the dazzling Caucasian Riviera. He savours the soul of Georgia in its wine and discovers a surprise nineteenth century tea plantation in the West Georgian countryside. The seat of power beckons in Kutaisi, home to the wonderful glass dome built for the Parliament of Georgia when it moved here from the capital, Tbilisi, in 2012.

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo discovers how Minneapolis harnessed the awesome power of the Mighty Mississippi to become a great industrial centre, the Mill City of the nation. And he finds how the city became the artificial limb capital of the world.

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.sub-title: Red Wing, Minnesota to Portage, Wisconsin
programme.desc: Michael continue his journey along the Mississippi to Red Wing, Minnesota. Picking up the Empire Builder rail service he travels to Winona, where he takes to the water to find out how the US Army Corps of Engineers made the Mississippi navigable.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads to North Yorkshire to pick up a veteran London-to-Brighton car, theres an emotional farewell to a 1980s Bedford HA van, and a Toyota Corona finds a new home.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek gives the once-over to a Royale Formula Ford race car, and Paul is on a marathon trip to Teesside to pick up a 1953 MGYB, a Moggy Van and an 80s Yamaha 250RD motorbike.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: An in-depth exploration of the assassination of one of the main architects of the Holocaust, Reinhard Heydrich, by British-trained Czechs.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head to Cheshire for a day of busy valuations at Arley Hall and Gardens. Combing through the thousands of objects brought in by visitors the experts are excited to discover two different items that have spent many years hidden from view - a gold bracelet found mysteriously bricked up behind a wall that is linked to a tragic love story, and a time capsule, buried in 1886, is opened on camera to reveal its secrets 130 years later.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A return visit to the enchanting gardens of Arley Hall in Cheshire finds Fiona Bruce and the team of experts hard at work. Its a rich day of finds as family treasures come under scrutiny. Amongst the objects featured are a portrait of a visitors mother which was painted in India in the 1950s.

programme.title: Operation Arctic with Simon Reeve

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: On Sri Lanka, the Chinese are building a huge new port and their money has helped the Sri Lankan government bring a 30-year war to a brutal end. Heading north to Bangladesh, Simon investigates one of the Indian Oceans fastest growing industries - providing prawns.

programme.title: The Lakes with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon looks at the impact of humans on Englands biggest and most popular national park. He goes wild swimming in the crystal-clear lake of Buttermere, before taking a look at the less-fortunate Derwent Water.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A return visit for Fiona Bruce and the team to the magnificent Broughton Castle near Banbury in Oxfordshire. programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
